txt.en: Mablung recalls standing at the halflings' camp-site.\n\nMablung is telling you more of the tale of the halflings in Ithilien. You should listen closely.
'That is all I have to tell, my friend.'
Mablung recalls the Southrons breaking through the trap.\n\nMablung is telling you more of the tale of the halflings in Ithilien. You should listen closely.
Mablung recalls the wild Mûmak and the aftermath of the battle.\n\nMablung is telling you more of the tale of the halflings in Ithilien. You should listen closely.
Mablung recalls guarding the halflings and speaking to them of their plans.\n\nMablung is telling you more of the tale of the halflings in Ithilien. You should listen closely.
'A great trumpet sounded as a Mûmak rushed forth, and in madness it slew all caught in its path...'
'I remained with the halflings as they slept and awaited my captain's return.'
'I spoke with the halflings for a time, and they asked much about me and my brethren...'
As the Rangers led the halflings through Ithilien, they spoke freely and prepared an ill-fated ambush for a company of Haradrim.
'Our trap had failed, for the Southrons broke through as arrows flew above us!'
